title: Rayleigh's 'Dull' Comment Foreshadowing
theory: Rayleigh's comment about 'one crew member who seemed dull' was not just referring to Zoro's inability to understand the message, but also foreshadowed Zoro's future development where his straightforward, combat-focused mindset would become both a strength and weakness. Some fans theorize this moment established that while Zoro is incredibly strong, he lacks the strategic thinking that other crew members possess.

title: Two-Year Time Skip Significance
theory: Fans theorized that the two-year time skip was specifically chosen because it matches significant real-world training periods and coming-of-age milestones. The theory suggests Oda chose this duration to allow characters to mature from teenagers to young adults, with Luffy going from 17 to 19, representing the transition from adolescence to adulthood in Japanese culture.

evidenceFor: Two years is a traditional training period in martial arts
